summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from late June/early July 2020 regarding travel approval for a law enforcement operation related to the Epstein investigation. The operation involved traveling to Massachusetts to arrest a target, with expenses detailed for four personnel.

events.title: Travel for Arrest Operation
events.description: Law enforcement personnel traveled to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, with plans to possibly escort the target back to New York.

events.title: Travel Request Submission
events.description: A request was submitted for travel approval to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation believed to be in Massachusetts.

keyFacts: In late June/early July 2020, law enforcement planned and executed a travel operation related to the Epstein investigation.
The operation's purpose was to arrest a target believed to be located in Massachusetts, with possible transport back to New York.
The travel involved four personnel, including two supervisors, and was approved using a specific operational travel code (EAN 564339.1).
The correspondence shows coordination between NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and the FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit.
The document references the 'Epstein investigation' as an active matter requiring travel and arrest operations in mid-2020.
